Question
========
  
The researchers randomly selected the students from program files. Closer inspection reveals that there are several students in the sample who have a double major. The grades of a few students are listed under both Social Science and Languages. The grades of two more students are listed under both Econ/Political Science and Languages.

Which condition of the two-way ANOVA did the researchers violate with this?

  
Answerlist
----------
* Random sample
* Independence of observations
* Equal variances
* Normal distribution of numbers 

Solution
========
  


Answerlist
----------
* This condition is not violated, since a random sample was drawn, or a random sample
* This condition is violated since there are students who are in more than 1 of the groups. It is important in an ANOVA that there are independent groups. This is not the case.
* This condition is an important one with this test, but this is not what the question is about.
